intro: Setaria lachnea, commonly known as rough false panicgrass, is a flowering plant species native to various parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and spikelet-based inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its small, wind-dispersed seeds contribute to its ability to colonize new areas. Setaria lachnea is often used in ecological studies due to its adaptability and role in soil stabilization.
